DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study examine whether Individualized Symptom Education Program ( ISEP ) helpful woman manage symptom receive radiation therapy gynecological cancer . It expect woman participate ISEP program well able manage symptom exprience less distress woman receive usual care .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Individualized Symptom Education Program ( ISEP )
DOC.detailed_description: Women radiation therapy gynecological cancer may experience number symptom include fatigue , pain , nausea , pelvic symptom ( urgent frequent urination bowel movement , vaginal discharge , vaginal itching , skin irritation ) , anxiety depression . We know individualized education program help people type cancer well manage symptom , would like find whether intervention helpful woman gynecological cancer . This study compare two type education : 1 ) symptom education program currently place ( usual care ) , 2 ) individualize symptom education program ( ISEP ) . This study conduct know one type education patient receive radiation gynecological cancer well . Both type education describe . Usual care : Usual symptom education radiation treatment consist receive verbal write education radiation oncologist , nurse radiation therapist , member interdisciplinary team . The radiation therapist see patient everyday radiation treatment doctor nurse see weekly basis . The patient also see member team , dietitian social worker require . Individualized symptom education : Individualized symptom education include usual symptom education also education program focus symptom management . The patient meet advanced practice nurse weekly basis six session 30 minute . The advanced practice nurse ask symptom paient experience bothersome . She give information specific strategy manage symptom , include write education material . These strategy base publish best practice guideline . Data symptom experience collect 3 point : baseline , completion education program ( end external beam treatment ) , 3 month follow completion education program ( 3 month follow completion external radiation treatment ) .
DOC.criteria: First time diagnosis cancer uterus , cervix , vagina , vulva Beginning first time radical radiation therapy pelvis least 4000cGy ( without brachytherapy external beam treatment without concurrent chemotherapy ) At least 18 year age Able speak understand English Receiving palliative cancer treatment Receiving split course radiation treatment Ovarian cancer
